page.title: 04RECREATION
page.content: The{Four Burrow Hunt hounds}have been tended by the huntsman, Mr.Hancock for four years. He has 34\ couples, or 69 hounds. He feeds them on raw flesh from the animals which have died on a farm. The hunt covers an area from{ {Camborne, Wadebridge}and nearly to {Helston.}About 60 people hunt at a time. Some children go. It costs{ {Â£17,000}a year to feed them and look after the hounds. Mr.Hancock breeds his own hounds but sometimes gets some from other hunts to improve the line. They are exercised everyday through out the time that they are not on the hunt. They are fed everyday when they are hunting and every other day when they are not. The hunting season is from{September}to{March.}They go out Tuesday, Thursday and Saturday. They do not hunt in the Summer because of the young foxes which are being born.
